article.headline: Fordham 90, Duquesne 81
article.story: PITTSBURGH (AP) -- Fordham received a scare from struggling Duquesne before winning 90-81 on Saturday. It was the Rams' second straight and third consecutive win over the Dukes. Sophomore forward Bryant Dunston led four Rams players in double figures with season-high 33 points, the highest scoring output of any Fordham player this season. It was the second-best showing of his career, surpassed only by a 34-point performance on Feb. 26, 2005, at St. Bonaventure. Sebastian Greene scored 16 points, while Marcus Stout and Jermaine Anderson each contributed 15 to help Fordham score 90 against Duquesne for the second time this season. The Rams scored 95 in a 15-point win at Fairfield on Dec. 14. Despite a losing record overall, Fordham (10-11, 5-3) remains a half-game out of second place in the Atlantic 10 Conference. Duquesne (3-17, 1-8) now has lost two consecutive games after posting its first conference win of the season with an 86-82 win Jan. 28 at St. Bonaventure. Both tams entered that matchup as the only teams without a win in conference play. Bryant McAllister led the Dukes with 16 points; Devario Hudson added 14 and Keith Gayden 12. McAllister also tied the school record for assists with 12, a mark originally set by Brian Shanahan in 1986 and matched twice, most recently by Martin Osimani on Jan. 7, 2004, against Ohio University. After trailing for much of the first half, the Rams chipped away at the Duquesne lead before Anderson hit a layup as time expired to lead 39-38 at the intermission. Duquesne fought back to tie the game at 53 early in the second half, but Fordham took control of the game with a 10-2 run and ended the Dukes' hopes of an upset.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
